intro: Chaptalia incana, commonly known as the gray chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Chaptalia incana is often found in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
